STORY, RATINGS AND REVIEWS

Story
Having the powers to time travel like all the family members even Tim Lake makes use of his extraordinary powers just to impress and win the woman of his dreams and his true love interest, Mary.
Ratings

7.8/10

IMDb

70%

Rotten Tomatoes
About Time Review

About time, has been categorized as a truly heartwarming and exceptionally overwhelming cute love story. The movie manages to touch the souls of everyone who sees it. The plot is emotionally charged and emphasizes a lot on the importance of cherishing every moment of our existence with our loved ones.The plot of the film is quite straightforward, unique, and well-organized. The additional element of time travelling is what makes the movie so extraordinary and appealing to the audience. Fans enjoyed the film for its well-crafted plot and the display of budding romance between the central characters. It happens to be a complete blend of romance, drama, and comedy. The film managed to receive a good IMDB rating and was also critically acclaimed by critics. Fans also loved the selection of cast members, and it seemed as if the actors were born to perfectly play the assigned characters. If you are searching for a heartwarming film that will leave you feeling happy and fulfilled, watch About Time.

TRIVIA AND POPULAR DIALOGUES

Trivia

Zooey Deschanel was originally cast as Mary but dropped out due to scheduling conflicts and Rachel McAdams replaced her.

Richard Griffiths's last movie.

When Tim mentions that it's a long walk to Mary's car, he's not kidding. The distance between Joanne's flat and Mary's apartment is about 6 miles across central London.

Towards the end of the film Rory is reading the book 'Trash' which is Curtis's next film (Curtis wrote the screenplay for both Trash (2014) and About Time (2013)).

Despite the film being set in England, none of the three actors who play the film's main love interests are actually English: Domhnall Gleeson is Irish, Rachel McAdams is Canadian, and Margot Robbie is Australian.

Popular Dialogues

"Tim: [voiceover] We're all traveling through time together, every day of our lives. All we can do is do our best to relish this remarkable ride."

"Tim: [voiceover] And so he told me his secret formula for happiness. Part one of the two-part plan was that I should just get on with ordinary life, living it day by day, like anyone else. Tim: [voiceover] But then came part two of Dad's plan. He told me to live every day again almost exactly the same. The first time with all the tensions and worries that stop us noticing how sweet the world can be, but the second time noticing. Okay, Dad. Let's give it a go."
